Item Name: Smooth Steel Tube 1/8” Wall Thickness 1” OD 20 ft
Description: Local steel shop Gerlinger’s sold this in a 20’ segment  which was good enough for my 2” by 2” initial build. People online use EMT conduit but I wanted to cut hard things and maybe push the dimensions of the machine later.
Everything you need in one convenient package. I asked for dual endstop wiring.
Commonly used drag chain comparable with mods printed.
Contains 500W DC spindle, speed control, ER11 collet, and some misc tools and spare end mills
A small flex-loc like hose with mounting block to blow away chips. Cheapest one I could find so may revise.
BFG of cheap estops. Good for 35 A at 120V (assuming RMS)
Mains input to rest of system with a nice switch. TODO FIND CORRECT FUSE

A decent cheap 32 bit board. Somebody else already wrote a marlin profile with dual end stop support specifically for the MPCNC which is why I went with this. The SKR V1.4 may be a cheap upgrade but I did not want to fiddle with profiles on the first pass. TMC2208s were chosen b/c the marlin profile used them but later TMC chips have more features and trinamic drivers may be superior.
Contains 10x each of V-shape, ball (2 flute), plunge (2 flute), and plunge (4 flute) carbide end mills
0.3mm to 1.2mm in 0.1mm steps with 5x of each type.

General purpose carbide endmill. Single flute supposedly allows for decent results in both wood and aluminum on a fast jank router. Unclear if necessary for the lower speed purposely built spindle above.
